attributes.comment:
I whole-heartedly support the fee increase. The American taxpayers should not be
expected to provide additional monies to support immigration. The U.S. has a very
liberal immigration policy, and those who wish to take advantage of it should be
willing to pay for it. It is a privilege; not a right. The government is not raising fees
in an attempt to make a profit; the government wants to cover its costs, and that is
a reasonable thing to do. Critics often complain about government inefficiency, but
one problem is that funds are not available to update systems to the 21st century.
In addition, applicants and petitioners often file incomplete or inaccurate
paperwork, resulting in additional processing costs. Many applications are
unnecessarily submitted through lawyers, who may charge high fees. Customers
can save money by submitting the paperwork themselves. The U.S. government
and taxpayers should not be expected to further subsidize immigration. The fee
increases are based on a thorough study. The proposed fee increases are
necessary and reasonable.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by K. Winter
